articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Greece, Israel and Cyprus call Turkey's planned Libya deployment 'dangerous escalation'
articles.description: Turkey's bill allowing troop deployment in Libya marks a dangerous escalation in the North African country's civil war and severely threatens stability in the region, a joint statement by Greece, Israel and Cyprus said late on Thursday.
articles.content:
ATHENS (Reuters) - Turkey’s bill allowing troop deployment in Libya marks a dangerous escalation in the North African country’s civil war and severely threatens stability in the region, a joint statement by Greece, Israel and Cyprus said late on Thursday.

articles.author: Babak Dehghanpisheh
articles.title: Soleimani was Iran's celebrity soldier, spearhead in Middle East
articles.description: Iranian Major-General Qassem Soleimani, the top commander of the elite Quds Force of the Revolutionary Guards, helped Iran fight proxy wars across the Middle East by inspiring militias on the battlefield and negotiating with political leaders.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - Iranian Major-General Qassem Soleimani, the top commander of the elite Quds Force of the Revolutionary Guards, helped Iran fight proxy wars across the Middle East by inspiring militias on the battlefield and negotiating with political leaders.

articles.author: Stefanie Eschenbacher
articles.title: With fates intertwined, Mexico and Pemex face downgrade risk in 2020
articles.description: Mexico threw troubled state oil company Pemex a lifeline in 2019 to stop $80 billion in bonds held by investors worldwide being labeled junk by credit rating agencies. Now, investors worry that the state itself is a risk for Pemex.
articles.content:
MEXICO CITY (Reuters) - Mexico threw troubled state oil company Pemex a lifeline in 2019 to stop $80 billion in bonds held by investors worldwide being labeled junk by credit rating agencies. Now, investors worry that the state itself is a risk for Pemex.

articles.author: Karl Plume
articles.title: RPT-INSIGHT-U.S. farmers see another bleak year despite Phase 1 trade deal
articles.description: Across snow-covered North Dakota, U.S. farmers are stuck with fields full of weather-damaged corn - a crop they planted after the U.S.-China trade war killed their soybean market. Many don't know yet what crops they'll plant next season among a host of dicey …
